name: 1-propanone, 1-(2-hydroxy-5-methylphenyl)-
Reason: 1-propanone, also known as acetone, has a melting point of -12.5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be propane, which has a melting point of -18.7°C. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methyl group and a hydroxyl group. The methyl group adds approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The hydroxyl group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which might raise the melting point by approximately +10°C.
